info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 2:17AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MCDOWELL...NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD...EAST CENTRAL HENDERSON...POLK...SOUTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE... WESTERN BURKE AND NORTHEASTERN GREENVILLE COUNTIES UNTIL 245 AM EDT... At 216 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Marion to 15 miles northwest of Rutherfordton to 13 miles south of Columbus, and moving north at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Marion, Columbus, Tryon, Lake Lure, Old Fort, Saluda, Chimney Rock Village, Lake James State Park, Chimney Rock State Park and Bat Cave. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
